page.title: 02BUSINESSES FLAMBOROUGH AREA
page.content: In Flamborough most of the shops are down High Street and Post Office Street with one or two elsewhere. The longest established shop down High Street sells groceries and sweets and has not changed much inside for over 30 years. The newest shops are a bakers and betting shop which opened this year. There is also a butchers shop, a bank and an antique shop. There are 2 fried fish shops, 2 ladies hairdressers, a walkaround general storea large family grocers, a fruit shop and a ladies drapers. Down Post Office Street is the Post Office, which also sells greetings cards and collects secondhand goods for Oxfam. There is a second bank and a mini- market whose main supermarkets are in Bridlington.
